page.title: 12THE SUPERINTENDENT
page.content: The Superintendent of the market is Mrs Watson. She has an office in the old Town Hall. Each week she gives the traders a ticket. On the 9th May 1985 she gave 55 tickets. We counted ten stalls in the Market Hall and fifty stalls on Church Street and the High Street. Some traders have more than one stall. Mrs Watson tries to have a wide variety of stalls to make the market more interesting. Because the market is so popular there is always a waiting list of traders trying to sell on the market. The stalls have to be taken down by 3.30pm.
